com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.Notifi.classDes: An internal class of the RemoteMessage class that indicates the notification message.

com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.Notifi.methodDes: This method is used to obtain the key of the localized content of a notification message for message display localization.
This method is used to obtain the URL of an image in a message.
com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.Notifi.returns: android.net.Uri:Image URL set by the developer. If no URL is set, null is returned

com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.Notifi.methodDes: This method is used to check whether a notification message uses the default vibration mode. For details, please refer to the description of use_default_vibrate in the AndroidNotification structure in Sending Messages.
This method is used to check whether a notification message is sticky.
This method is used to obtain the displayed content of a message.
his method is used to obtain the colors (in #RRGGBB format) of icons in a message.
com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.Notifi.returns: java.lang.String:Colors of icons in a message

com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.Notifi.methodDes: This method is used to check whether a notification message uses the default notification light settings.
This method is used to obtain variable string values in the localized title of a notification message.
This method is used to obtain the image resource name of a notification icon. On an Android device, all icon files are stored in the /res/raw/** directory of the app.
com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.Notifi.returns: java.lang.String:Icon resource file name, for example, /raw/ic_launcher, corresponding to the local file /res/raw/ic_launcher.png

com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.Notifi.methodDes: This method is used to obtain the text to be displayed on the status bar for a notification message.
This method is used to obtain IDs of channels that support the display of a message. If no channel is set, null is returned.
This method is used to obtain the action triggered upon notification message tapping.
com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.Notifi.returns: java.lang.String:Action triggered upon notification message tapping. The action returned must be the same as the action declared in the intent-filter tag of Activity defined in AndroidManifest.xml

com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.Notifi.methodDes: This method is used to obtain the tag from a message for message overwriting. A message will be overwritten by another message with the same tag but is sent later.
This method is used to obtain the name of an audio resource to be played when a notification message is displayed.
com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.Notifi.returns: java.lang.String:Audio resource file name, for example, /raw/shake, corresponding to the local file /res/raw/shake.mp3

com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.Notifi.methodDes: This method is used to obtain the blinking frequency and color of a breathing light.
This method is used to obtain the key of the localized title of a notification message for message display localization.
This method is used to obtain the visibility of a notification message. For details, please refer to the definition of visibility in the AndroidNotification structure.
This method is used to obtain the priority of a notification message.
This method is used to obtain the deep link from a message. A deep link is a specific URL, such as the URL of a web page or rich media. If no URL is set, null is returned.
This method is used to obtain variable string values in the localized content of a message.
This method is used to obtain the vibration mode of a message.
com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.Notifi.returns: long[]:Array consisting of at most 10 elements, with each in milliseconds

com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.Notifi.methodDes: his method is used to check whether a notification message uses the default sound.
This method is used to obtain the number of notification messages.
This method is used to obtain the time (in milliseconds) when an event occurs from a notification message. Developers can sort notification messages by this time.
This method is used to obtain the title of a message.

com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.classDes: A message entity class. An app calls the onMessageReceived(RemoteMessage) method in HmsMessageService to receive messages pushed by the server and calls the send(RemoteMessage) method in HmsMessaging to send uplink messages.

com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.getUrg.methodDes: Obtains the message priority set on the HUAWEI Push Kit server.
com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.getUrg.returns: int:Message priority. For details, please refer to the definition in Constants of the RemoteMessage class

com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.getMes.methodDes: Obtains the ID of a message.

com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.getCol.methodDes: Obtains the classification identifier (collapse key) of a message.

com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.getDat.methodDes: Obtains the payload of a Map message.
com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.getDat.returns: java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.lang.String>:If data is set to 123 in the message sent, the getData() method returns "123" and this method returns null

com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.getOri.methodDes: Obtains the message priority set by the app.
com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.getOri.returns: int:Message priority. For details, please refer to the definition in Constants of the RemoteMessage class

com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.getTo(.methodDes: Obtains the recipient of a message.

com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.getNot.methodDes: Obtains the notification data instance from a message.

com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.getFro.methodDes: Obtains the resource of a message.

com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.getMes.methodDes: Obtains the type of a message.
com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.getMes.returns: java.lang.String:Message type set by the developer and transparently transmitted by the SDK

com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.getTtl.methodDes: Obtains the maximum cache duration of a message.
com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.getTtl.returns: int:Maximum cache duration of a message, in seconds

com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.getSen.methodDes: Obtains the time when a message is sent from the server.
com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.getSen.returns: long:Number of milliseconds from 00:00:00 on January 1, 1970 to the time when a message is sent from the server

com.huawei.hms.aaid.entity.AAIDResult.classDes: Bears and returns AAIDs obtained through the getAAID() method in HmsInstanceId You can call the getId() method in the AAIDResult class to obtain an AAID.

com.huawei.hms.aaid.entity.AAIDResult.ge.methodDes: Obtains the AAID of an app.

com.huawei.hms.push.HmsMessaging.classDes: A class that provides methods for subscribing to topics and enables or disables the function of receiving notification messages.

com.huawei.hms.push.HmsMessaging.isAutoI.methodDes: Checks whether automatic initialization is enabled.
com.huawei.hms.push.HmsMessaging.isAutoI.returns: boolean:Boolean value. The value true indicates that automatic initialization is enabled and false indicates that automatic initialization is not enabled

com.huawei.hms.push.HmsMessaging.subscri.methodDes: Subscribes to topics in asynchronous mode.
com.huawei.hms.push.HmsMessaging.subscri.returns: com.huawei.hmf.tasks.Task<java.lang.Void>:You need to add a listener to listen to the operation result

com.huawei.hms.push.HmsMessaging.unsubsc.methodDes: Unsubscribes from topics in asynchronous mode.

params.topic: Name of a topic to be unsubscribed from

com.huawei.hms.push.HmsMessaging.unsubsc.returns: com.huawei.hmf.tasks.Task<java.lang.Void>:You need to add a listener to listen to the operation result

com.huawei.hms.push.HmsMessaging.setAuto.methodDes: Determines whether to enable automatic initialization.

params.enable: Indicates whether to enable automatic initialization. The value true indicates yes and false indicates no

com.huawei.hms.push.HmsMessaging.send(co.methodDes: Sends upstream messages in asynchronous mode.

com.huawei.hms.push.HmsMessaging.DEFAULT.des: Default value of the scope parameter when the HmsInstanceId.getToken(String appid, String scope) method is called to obtain a registration token.

com.huawei.hms.aaid.HmsInstanceId.classDes: Provides methods for obtaining the AAID of an app and obtaining tokens required for accessing HUAWEI Push Kit.

com.huawei.hms.aaid.HmsInstanceId.getAAI.methodDes: Obtains an AAID in asynchronous mode.
com.huawei.hms.aaid.HmsInstanceId.getAAI.returns: com.huawei.hmf.tasks.Task<com.huawei.hms.aaid.entity.AAIDResult>:You need to add a listener to listen to the operation result. If the operation is successful, you can obtain the AAID using the AAIDResult.getId() method

com.huawei.hms.aaid.HmsInstanceId.getId(.methodDes: Obtains an AAID in synchronous mode.

com.huawei.hms.aaid.HmsInstanceId.getIns.methodDes: Obtains the instance of the HmsInstanceId class.

Exceptions.java.lang.NullPointerException: Exception that occurs when an input parameter is an empty reference

com.huawei.hms.aaid.HmsInstanceId.delete.methodDes: Deletes a local AAID and its generation timestamp.

Exceptions.java.lang.ApiException: All exceptions that occur when this method fails to be called are thrown through the ApiException class. You can obtain exception information using the methods provided by the ApiException class

params.appId: App ID allocated when an app is created in AppGallery Connect

Exceptions.java.lang.ApiException: All exceptions that occur when this method fails to be called are thrown through the ApiException class

com.huawei.hms.aaid.HmsInstanceId.getCre.methodDes: Obtains the generation timestamp of an AAID.
com.huawei.hms.aaid.HmsInstanceId.getCre.returns: long:Timestamp, which is the number of milliseconds from 00:00:00 on January 1, 1970 to the AAID generation time

com.huawei.hms.aaid.HmsInstanceId.getTok.methodDes: Obtains a token. This method is not recommended. You are advised to use the getToken(String appId, String scope) method to obtain tokens.
com.huawei.hms.aaid.HmsInstanceId.getTok.returns: java.lang.String:Token required for accessing HUAWEI Push Kit

com.huawei.hms.aaid.HmsInstanceId.getTok.methodDes: Obtains a token required for accessing HUAWEI Push Kit.

params.appId: App ID allocated when an app is created in AppGallery Connect

com.huawei.hms.aaid.HmsInstanceId.getTok.returns: java.lang.String:Token required for accessing HUAWEI Push Kit

Exceptions.java.lang.ApiException: All exceptions that occur when this method fails to be called are thrown through the ApiException class

com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.Builde.methodDes: Sets the classification identifier of a message.

params.collapseKey: If you set collapse_key to -1, all offline messages of the app are sent to the device.If you set collapse_key to 0, offline messages of the app sent to the device are determined by the default policy of HUAWEI Push

com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.Builde.methodDes: This method is used to add key-value pair data to a message.

params.key: Key in a key-value pair, for example, name
params.value: Value in a key-value pair, for example, ZhangSan

com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.Builde.methodDes: Sets the ID of a message.

params.messageId: Message ID, which is generated by an app and is unique for each message

com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.Builde.methodDes: Sets the maximum cache duration of a message, in seconds.

params.ttl: Maximum cache duration of an offline message set for HUAWEI Push Kit, in seconds. The duration can be set to 15 days at most

com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.Builde.methodDes: Sets Map data to a message.
Sets the type of a message.

params.messageType: Message type specified by the developer

com.huawei.hms.push.RemoteMessage.Builde.methodDes: This method is used to construct a RemoteMessage instance.

com.huawei.hms.push.HmsMessageService.classDes: Basic class of HUAWEI Push Kit for receiving downlink messages or updated tokens.

com.huawei.hms.push.HmsMessageService.on.methodDes: Receives data messages pushed by the app server.
Called when the Cloud Messaging server deletes pending messages.
Called after an uplink message is successfully sent.
Called after an uplink message fails to be sent.

params.exception: Exception of the BaseException type, including the error code obtained by getErrorCode() and the description obtained by getMessage()

com.huawei.hms.push.HmsMessageService.on.methodDes: The app calls the getToken method in HmsInstanceId to apply for a token from the server.

params.token: Token returned by the HMS Core Push SDK.

com.huawei.hms.push.HmsMessageService.on.methodDes: Called by the system to notify a Service that it is no longer used and is being removed.

com.huawei.hms.push.BaseException.getErr.returns: int:Result code. For the definition of result codes, please refer to ErrorEnum

com.huawei.hms.opendevice.OpenDeviceClie.classDes: Provides the method of obtaining an ODID.

com.huawei.hms.opendevice.OpenDeviceClie.methodDes: Obtains an ODID in asynchronous mode.

com.huawei.hms.support.api.opendevice.Od.classDes: Entity class, which is used to carry and return the ODID obtained in asynchronous mode.

com.huawei.hms.opendevice.OpenDevice.classDes: Provides the method of obtaining the instance of the OpenDeviceClient implementation class.

com.huawei.hms.opendevice.OpenDevice.get.methodDes: Obtains the instance of the OpenDeviceClient implementation class.
com.huawei.hms.opendevice.OpenDevice.get.returns: com.huawei.hms.opendevice.OpenDeviceClient:An instance of the OpenDeviceClient implementation class
